definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Xiao Gang's father is the prince of folk singing in his village.
sentences.chinese: 小剛的阿爸是全寨子的山歌王。

sentences.english: Ballad is a favorite art for people in Youjiang area.
sentences.chinese: 山歌是右江地區羣衆最爲喜愛的藝術形式。

sentences.english: Hakka Folk Songs in Guangdong is an artistic miracle of folk arts in China.
sentences.chinese: 廣東客家山歌是中國民間藝苑中一支獨具異彩的奇葩。

sentences.english: The mountaineers sing folk songs for amusement.
sentences.chinese: 山居者以唱山歌作消遣。

sentences.english: Folks songs are forgotten when not sung.
Now Guangdong Hakka's Folk Song is ancient and energetic, and successors are needed urgently.
sentences.chinese: 當下廣東客家山歌夕陽正紅，但是後繼者亟待培養。

sentences.english: Xinhua folk songs are a bright pearl in Chinese folk songs.
sentences.chinese: 新化山歌是中華民歌中的一顆璀璨的明珠。

sentences.english: There are many differences between Hakka folk songs and foreign folk so…
sentences.chinese: 客家山歌與外國民歌相比，存在很大的差異。

sentences.english: Love songs in Western Chongqing is a main part of the folk songs in this area.
sentences.chinese: 渝西情歌是渝西山歌中極重要的一部分。

sentences.english: Baise Pinhua mountain songs are an important form of folk arts for the Baise people who speak the Pinghua dialect.
sentences.chinese: 百色平話山歌是百色平話人民間文藝的一種重要形式。

definition: answering phrase of duet/to sing antiphonal answer
suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
Hakka ethnic group, a subgroup of the Han that in the 13th century migrated from northern China to the south
suona, Chinese shawm/see 嗩吶|唢呐
Yao ethnic group of southwest China and southeast Asia
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
Zhuang language/language of the Zhuang ethnic group 壯族|壮族[Zhuang4 zu2] of Guangxi
boisterous live show held during the Ghost Festival 中元節|中元节[Zhong1 yuan2 jie2] in Singapore and other parts of Southeast Asia
